basics.name: Ruishi Chen
basics.summary: PhD Student in Education Data Science at Stanford University, specializing in Social Network Methods, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Computer Vision

work.company: MIMIR Knowledge Creation Lab, Stanford University
Brain Development & Education Lab, Stanford University

highlights: Recruited and led a diverse team of 42 panelists and 65 volunteers located in 10 different countries
Created Objective Key Results to establish a management system across six departments
Hosted Education Equity Panel and launched initiative to provide vocational education to 150 students

work.company: Shanghai Victor Education Technology Co., Ltd.
highlights: Designed online curricula for Chinese teenagers' skill development
Assisted 3 students with college major selection; helped 2 students enroll in dream programs
Recruited 600 volunteers for pen-pal program between urban college and rural primary students
Established strategic partnerships between non-profits and rural schools
Raised funds for educational infrastructure improvements including multimedia systems

work.company: Woodruff Health Educators Academy (WHEA), Emory University
highlights: Designed survey and interview protocols for mix-method research
Analyzed survey data and interview transcripts for program quality evaluation

publications.name: Cheating after a full academic year with Generative AI Chatbots: A Follow-up study on initial student cheating behaviors
publications.summary: Chen, R., Lee, V. R., Kuo, A., Pope, D., & Miles, S. (2024)

publications.name: A Cross-Sectional Look at Teacher Reactions, Worries, and Professional Development Needs Related to Generative AI in an Urban School District
publications.summary: Chen, R., Lee, V. R., & Lee, M. (in press)

publications.name: Adolescent cheating with generative AI after a full-academic year: A status check
publications.publisher: Society for Research in Child Development 2025 Biennial Meeting
publications.summary: Lee, V. R., Chen, R., Kuo, A. C., & Pope, D. (2025)

publications.name: Middle School Students' Attitude and Self-efficacy Changes Towards Data and English Language Arts Following Instructional Integration
publications.summary: Lee, V. R., Chen, R., Levine, S., & Demszky, D. (2025)

publications.name: Can Students Step Up Their Mathematical Learning through Movement? A Course Evaluation for Move Your Math
publications.summary: Chen, R. (2023). Unpublished undergraduate honor thesis, Emory University

teaching.course: Undergraduate Teaching Assistants (UTAs) in Emory College
teaching.description: Teaching Assistants for Introduction to Statistical Computing with R. Faculty Advisor: Professor Hojin Kim

teaching.course: Move Your Math: Embodied Learning Seminar
teaching.description: Instructor/Faculty Advisor: Professor Manuela Manetta, Professor Lori Teague

portfolio.name: Educational Code-switched Language Pipeline with Encoder-Decoder Architecture
portfolio.description: Developed encoder-decoder architecture with transfer learning for Mandarin-English code-switched instructional language processing

portfolio.name: Movie Recommender Chatbot Product Development Project
portfolio.description: Built a Python-based chatbot that recommends movies using sentiment analysis and multiple AI approaches

portfolio.name: Drowsiness Detection for Student Attention Monitoring
portfolio.description: Architected multi-modal attention monitoring system using LeNet-5 CNN with fine-tuned MobileNetV2

portfolio.name: Quality Measurements for Reflective Session Notes: Understanding Mentorship
portfolio.description: Processed and analyzed 18,911 session notes using NLTK and TextBlob for mentorship quality assessment
